titlestmt.subtitle:
An inventory of
the collection at Syracuse University
titlestmt.author: [Summit record]

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.abstract: Records, reports, resolutions, statistics, minute books, cashbooks, and attendance records of Methodist Conferences in New York State. Records most complete for the Oneida Conference (1830-1915) and the Central New York Conference (1890-1915). Also, some material on the Black River Conference, the East Genesee Conference, the Genesee Conference, and the Wyoming Conference. The Oneida Conference records include material on immorality trials, 1830-1870.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents of the Collection
scopecontent.p: The Methodist Manuscript Collection consists of Records, reports, resolutions, statistics, minute books, cashbooks, and attendance records of various Methodist conferences in New York State. Records are most complete for the Oneida Conference (1830-1915) and the Central New York Conference (1890-1915). Other conferences represented are the Black River Conference, the East Genesee Conference, the Genesee Conference, and the Wyoming Conference. The Oneida Conference records include material on immorality trials, 1830-1870.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: &scrc_name; has extensive holdings relating to the Methodist church and clergy in New York State. Please refer to &subjindex; for a complete listing of related manuscript collection and to &summitref; for cataloged print items.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The majority of our archival and manuscript collections are housed offsite and require advanced notice for retrieval. Researchers are encouraged to contact us in advance concerning the collection material they wish to access for their research.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Written permission must be obtained from SCRC andall relevant rights holders before publishing quotations, excerpts or images from anymaterials in this collection.
